2000 def _get_indices_set(self): 

2001 indset = set([]) 

2002 for arg in self.args: 

2003 if isinstance(arg, TensExpr): 

2004 indset.update(arg._get_indices_set()) 

2005 return indset 

2006 

2007 @property 

2008 def _iterate_dummy_indices(self): 

2009 dummy_set = self._get_dummy_indices_set() 

2010 

2011 def recursor(expr, pos): 

2012 if isinstance(expr, TensorIndex): 

2013 if expr in dummy_set: 

2014 yield (expr, pos) 

2015 elif isinstance(expr, (Tuple, TensExpr)): 

2016 for p, arg in enumerate(expr.args): 

2017 for i in recursor(arg, pos+(p,)): 

2018 yield i 

2019 

2020 return recursor(self, ()) 

2021 

2022 @property 

2023 def _iterate_free_indices(self): 

2024 free_set = self._get_free_indices_set() 

2025 

2026 def recursor(expr, pos): 

2027 if isinstance(expr, TensorIndex): 

2028 if expr in free_set: 

2029 yield (expr, pos) 

2030 elif isinstance(expr, (Tuple, TensExpr)): 

2031 for p, arg in enumerate(expr.args): 

2032 for i in recursor(arg, pos+(p,)): 

2033 yield i 

2034 

2035 return recursor(self, ()) 

2036 

2037 @property 

2038 def _iterate_indices(self): 

2039 def recursor(expr, pos): 

2040 if isinstance(expr, TensorIndex): 

2041 yield (expr, pos) 

2042 elif isinstance(expr, (Tuple, TensExpr)): 

2043 for p, arg in enumerate(expr.args): 

2044 for i in recursor(arg, pos+(p,)): 

2045 yield i 

2046 

2047 return recursor(self, ()) 

2048 

2049 @staticmethod 

2050 def _match_indices_with_other_tensor(array, free_ind1, free_ind2, replacement_dict): 

2051 from .array import tensorcontraction, tensorproduct, permutedims 

2052 

2053 index_types1 = [i.tensor_index_type for i in free_ind1] 

2054 

2055 # Check if variance of indices needs to be fixed: 

2056 pos2up = [] 

2057 pos2down = [] 

2058 free2remaining = free_ind2[:] 

2059 for pos1, index1 in enumerate(free_ind1): 

2060 if index1 in free2remaining: 

2061 pos2 = free2remaining.index(index1) 

2062 free2remaining[pos2] = None 

2063 continue 

2064 if -index1 in free2remaining: 

2065 pos2 = free2remaining.index(-index1) 

2066 free2remaining[pos2] = None 

2067 free_ind2[pos2] = index1 

2068 if index1.is_up: 

2069 pos2up.append(pos2) 

2070 else: 

2071 pos2down.append(pos2) 

2072 else: 

2073 index2 = free2remaining[pos1] 

2074 if index2 is None: 

2075 raise ValueError("incompatible indices: %s and %s" % (free_ind1, free_ind2)) 

2076 free2remaining[pos1] = None 

2077 free_ind2[pos1] = index1 

2078 if index1.is_up ^ index2.is_up: 

2079 if index1.is_up: 

2080 pos2up.append(pos1) 

2081 else: 

2082 pos2down.append(pos1) 

2083 

2084 if len(set(free_ind1) & set(free_ind2)) < len(free_ind1): 

2085 raise ValueError("incompatible indices: %s and %s" % (free_ind1, free_ind2)) 

2086 

2087 # TODO: add possibility of metric after (spinors) 

2088 def contract_and_permute(metric, array, pos): 

2089 array = tensorcontraction(tensorproduct(metric, array), (1, 2+pos)) 

2090 permu = list(range(len(free_ind1))) 

2091 permu[0], permu[pos] = permu[pos], permu[0] 

2092 return permutedims(array, permu) 

2093 

2094 # Raise indices: 

2095 for pos in pos2up: 

2096 metric = replacement_dict[index_types1[pos]] 

2097 metric_inverse = _TensorDataLazyEvaluator.inverse_matrix(metric) 

2098 array = contract_and_permute(metric_inverse, array, pos) 

2099 # Lower indices: 

2100 for pos in pos2down: 

2101 metric = replacement_dict[index_types1[pos]] 

2102 array = contract_and_permute(metric, array, pos) 

2103 

2104 if free_ind1: 

2105 permutation = TensExpr._get_indices_permutation(free_ind2, free_ind1) 

2106 array = permutedims(array, permutation) 

2107 

2108 if hasattr(array, "rank") and array.rank() == 0: 

2109 array = array[()] 

2110 

2111 return free_ind2, array 

2112 

2113 def replace_with_arrays(self, replacement_dict, indices): 

2114 """ 

2115 Replace the tensorial expressions with arrays. The final array will 

2116 correspond to the N-dimensional array with indices arranged according 

2117 to ``indices``. 

2118 

2119 Parameters 

2120 ========== 

2121 

2122 replacement_dict 

2123 dictionary containing the replacement rules for tensors. 

2124 indices 

2125 the index order with respect to which the array is read. 

2126 

2127 Examples 

2128 ======== 

2129 

2130 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices 

2131 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import tensorhead 

2132 >>> from sympy import symbols, diag 

2133 

2134 >>> L = TensorIndexType("L") 

2135 >>> i, j = tensor_indices("i j", L) 

2136 >>> A = tensorhead("A", [L], [[1]]) 

2137 >>> A(i).replace_with_arrays({A(i): [1, 2]}, [i]) 

2138 [1, 2] 

2139 >>> expr = A(i)*A(j) 

2140 >>> expr.replace_with_arrays({A(i): [1, 2]}, [i, j]) 

2141 [[1, 2], [2, 4]] 

2142 

2143 For contractions, specify the metric of the ``TensorIndexType``, which 

2144 in this case is ``L``, in its covariant form: 

2145 

2146 >>> expr = A(i)*A(-i) 

2147 >>> expr.replace_with_arrays({A(i): [1, 2], L: diag(1, -1)}, []) 

2148 -3 

2149 

2150 Symmetrization of an array: 

2151 

2152 >>> H = tensorhead("H", [L, L], [[1], [1]]) 

2153 >>> a, b, c, d = symbols("a b c d") 

2154 >>> expr = H(i, j)/2 + H(j, i)/2 

2155 >>> expr.replace_with_arrays({H(i, j): [[a, b], [c, d]]}, [i, j]) 

2156 [[a, b/2 + c/2], [b/2 + c/2, d]] 

2157 

2158 Anti-symmetrization of an array: 

2159 

2160 >>> expr = H(i, j)/2 - H(j, i)/2 

2161 >>> repl = {H(i, j): [[a, b], [c, d]]} 

2162 >>> expr.replace_with_arrays(repl, [i, j]) 

2163 [[0, b/2 - c/2], [-b/2 + c/2, 0]] 

2164 

2165 The same expression can be read as the transpose by inverting ``i`` and 

2166 ``j``: 

2167 

2168 >>> expr.replace_with_arrays(repl, [j, i]) 

2169 [[0, -b/2 + c/2], [b/2 - c/2, 0]] 

2170 """ 

2171 from .array import Array 

2172 

2173 replacement_dict = {tensor: Array(array) for tensor, array in replacement_dict.items()} 

2174 

2175 # Check dimensions of replaced arrays: 

2176 for tensor, array in replacement_dict.items(): 

2177 if isinstance(tensor, TensorIndexType): 

2178 expected_shape = [tensor.dim for i in range(2)] 

2179 else: 

2180 expected_shape = [index_type.dim for index_type in tensor.index_types] 

2181 if len(expected_shape) != array.rank() or (not all([dim1 == dim2 if 

2182 dim1 is not None else True for dim1, dim2 in zip(expected_shape, 

2183 array.shape)])): 

2184 raise ValueError("shapes for tensor %s expected to be %s, "\ 

2185 "replacement array shape is %s" % (tensor, expected_shape, 

2186 array.shape)) 

2187 

2188 ret_indices, array = self._extract_data(replacement_dict) 

2189 

2190 last_indices, array = self._match_indices_with_other_tensor(array, indices, ret_indices, replacement_dict) 

2191 #permutation = self._get_indices_permutation(indices, ret_indices) 

2192 #if not hasattr(array, "rank"): 

2193 #return array 

2194 #if array.rank() == 0: 

2195 #array = array[()] 

2196 #return array 

2197 #array = permutedims(array, permutation) 

2198 return array 

2199 

2200 def _check_add_Sum(self, expr, index_symbols): 

2201 from sympy import Sum 

2202 indices = self.get_indices() 

2203 dum = self.dum 

2204 sum_indices = [ (index_symbols[i], 0, 

2205 indices[i].tensor_index_type.dim-1) for i, j in dum] 

2206 if sum_indices: 

2207 expr = Sum(expr, *sum_indices) 

2208 return expr 

2209 

2210 

2211class TensAdd(TensExpr, AssocOp): 

2212 """ 

2213 Sum of tensors 

2214 

2215 Parameters 

2216 ========== 

2217 

2218 free_args : list of the free indices 

2219 

2220 Attributes 

2221 ========== 

2222 

2223 ``args`` : tuple of addends 

2224 ``rank`` : rank of the tensor 

2225 ``free_args`` : list of the free indices in sorted order 

2226 

2227 Notes 

2228 ===== 

2229 

2230 Sum of more than one tensor are put automatically in canonical form. 

2231 

2232 Examples 

2233 ======== 

2234 

2235 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensorhead, tensor_indices 

2236 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dummy_fmt='L') 

2237 >>> a, b = tensor_indices('a,b', Lorentz) 

2238 >>> p, q = tensorhead('p,q', [Lorentz], [[1]]) 

2239 >>> t = p(a) + q(a); t 

2240 p(a) + q(a) 

2241 >>> t(b) 

2242 p(b) + q(b) 

2243 

2244 Examples with components data added to the tensor expression: 

2245 

2246 >>> from sympy import symbols, diag 

2247 >>> x, y, z, t = symbols("x y z t") 

2248 >>> repl = {} 

2249 >>> repl[Lorentz] = diag(1, -1, -1, -1) 

2250 >>> repl[p(a)] = [1, 2, 3, 4] 

2251 >>> repl[q(a)] = [x, y, z, t] 

2252 

2253 The following are: 2**2 - 3**2 - 2**2 - 7**2 ==> -58 

2254 

2255 >>> expr = p(a) + q(a) 

2256 >>> expr.replace_with_arrays(repl, [a]) 

2257 [x + 1, y + 2, z + 3, t + 4] 

2258 """ 

2259 

2260 def __new__(cls, *args, **kw_args): 

2261 args = [_sympify(x) for x in args if x] 

2262 

2263 args = TensAdd._tensAdd_flatten(args) 

2264 

2265 obj = Basic.__new__(cls, *args, **kw_args) 

2266 return obj 

2267 

2268 def doit(self, **kwargs): 

2269 deep = kwargs.get('deep', True) 

2270 if deep: 

2271 args = [arg.doit(**kwargs) for arg in self.args] 

2272 else: 

2273 args = self.args 

2274 

2275 if not args: 

2276 return S.Zero 

2277 

2278 if len(args) == 1 and not isinstance(args[0], TensExpr): 

2279 return args[0] 

2280 

2281 # now check that all addends have the same indices: 

2282 TensAdd._tensAdd_check(args) 

2283 

2284 # if TensAdd has only 1 element in its `args`: 

2285 if len(args) == 1: # and isinstance(args[0], TensMul): 

2286 return args[0] 

2287 

2288 # Remove zeros: 

2289 args = [x for x in args if x] 

2290 

2291 # if there are no more args (i.e. have cancelled out), 

2292 # just return zero: 

2293 if not args: 

2294 return S.Zero 

2295 

2296 if len(args) == 1: 

2297 return args[0] 

2298 

2299 # Collect terms appearing more than once, differing by their coefficients: 

2300 args = TensAdd._tensAdd_collect_terms(args) 

2301 

2302 # collect canonicalized terms 

2303 def sort_key(t): 

2304 x = get_index_structure(t) 

2305 if not isinstance(t, TensExpr): 

2306 return ([], [], []) 

2307 return (t.components, x.free, x.dum) 

2308 args.sort(key=sort_key) 

2309 

2310 if not args: 

2311 return S.Zero 

2312 # it there is only a component tensor return it 

2313 if len(args) == 1: 

2314 return args[0] 

2315 

2316 obj = self.func(*args) 

2317 return obj 

2318 

2319 @staticmethod 

2320 def _tensAdd_flatten(args): 

2321 # flatten TensAdd, coerce terms which are not tensors to tensors 

2322 a = [] 

2323 for x in args: 

2324 if isinstance(x, (Add, TensAdd)): 

2325 a.extend(list(x.args)) 

2326 else: 

2327 a.append(x) 

2328 args = [x for x in a if x.coeff] 

2329 return args 

2330 

2331 @staticmethod 

2332 def _tensAdd_check(args): 

2333 # check that all addends have the same free indices 

2334 indices0 = set([x[0] for x in get_index_structure(args[0]).free]) 

2335 list_indices = [set([y[0] for y in get_index_structure(x).free]) for x in args[1:]] 

2336 if not all(x == indices0 for x in list_indices): 

2337 raise ValueError('all tensors must have the same indices') 

2338 

2339 @staticmethod 

2340 def _tensAdd_collect_terms(args): 

2341 # collect TensMul terms differing at most by their coefficient 

2342 terms_dict = defaultdict(list) 

2343 scalars = S.Zero 

2344 if isinstance(args[0], TensExpr): 

2345 free_indices = set(args[0].get_free_indices()) 

2346 else: 

2347 free_indices = set([]) 

2348 

2349 for arg in args: 

2350 if not isinstance(arg, TensExpr): 

2351 if free_indices != set([]): 

2352 raise ValueError("wrong valence") 

2353 scalars += arg 

2354 continue 

2355 if free_indices != set(arg.get_free_indices()): 

2356 raise ValueError("wrong valence") 

2357 # TODO: what is the part which is not a coeff? 

2358 # needs an implementation similar to .as_coeff_Mul() 

2359 terms_dict[arg.nocoeff].append(arg.coeff) 

2360 

2361 new_args = [TensMul(Add(*coeff), t).doit() for t, coeff in terms_dict.items() if Add(*coeff) != 0] 

2362 if isinstance(scalars, Add): 

2363 new_args = list(scalars.args) + new_args 

2364 elif scalars != 0: 

2365 new_args = [scalars] + new_args 

2366 return new_args 

2367 

2368 def get_indices(self): 

2369 indices = [] 

2370 for arg in self.args: 

2371 indices.extend([i for i in get_indices(arg) if i not in indices]) 

2372 return indices 

2373 

2374 @property 

2375 def rank(self): 

2376 return self.args[0].rank 

2377 

2378 @property 

2379 def free_args(self): 

2380 return self.args[0].free_args 

2381 

2382 def _expand(self, **hints): 

2383 return TensAdd(*[_expand(i, **hints) for i in self.args]) 

2384 

2385 def __call__(self, *indices): 

2386 """Returns tensor with ordered free indices replaced by ``indices`` 

2387 

2388 Parameters 

2389 ========== 

2390 

2391 indices 

2392 

2393 Examples 

2394 ======== 

2395 

2396 >>> from sympy import Symbol 

2397 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

2398 >>> D = Symbol('D') 

2399 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dim=D, dummy_fmt='L') 

2400 >>> i0,i1,i2,i3,i4 = tensor_indices('i0:5', Lorentz) 

2401 >>> p, q = tensorhead('p,q', [Lorentz], [[1]]) 

2402 >>> g = Lorentz.metric 

2403 >>> t = p(i0)*p(i1) + g(i0,i1)*q(i2)*q(-i2) 

2404 >>> t(i0,i2) 

2405 metric(i0, i2)*q(L_0)*q(-L_0) + p(i0)*p(i2) 

2406 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import canon_bp 

2407 >>> canon_bp(t(i0,i1) - t(i1,i0)) 

2408 0 

2409 """ 

2410 free_args = self.free_args 

2411 indices = list(indices) 

2412 if [x.tensor_index_type for x in indices] != [x.tensor_index_type for x in free_args]: 

2413 raise ValueError('incompatible types') 

2414 if indices == free_args: 

2415 return self 

2416 index_tuples = list(zip(free_args, indices)) 

2417 a = [x.func(*x.fun_eval(*index_tuples).args) for x in self.args] 

2418 res = TensAdd(*a).doit() 

2419 return res 

2420 

2421 def canon_bp(self): 

2422 """ 

2423 canonicalize using the Butler-Portugal algorithm for canonicalization 

2424 under monoterm symmetries. 

2425 """ 

2426 expr = self.expand() 

2427 args = [canon_bp(x) for x in expr.args] 

2428 res = TensAdd(*args).doit() 

2429 return res 

2430 

2431 def equals(self, other): 

2432 other = _sympify(other) 

2433 if isinstance(other, TensMul) and other._coeff == 0: 

2434 return all(x._coeff == 0 for x in self.args) 

2435 if isinstance(other, TensExpr): 

2436 if self.rank != other.rank: 

2437 return False 

2438 if isinstance(other, TensAdd): 

2439 if set(self.args) != set(other.args): 

2440 return False 

2441 else: 

2442 return True 

2443 t = self - other 

2444 if not isinstance(t, TensExpr): 

2445 return t == 0 

2446 else: 

2447 if isinstance(t, TensMul): 

2448 return t._coeff == 0 

2449 else: 

2450 return all(x._coeff == 0 for x in t.args) 

2451 

2452 def __getitem__(self, item): 

2453 deprecate_data() 

2454 return self.data[item] 

2455 

2456 def contract_delta(self, delta): 

2457 args = [x.contract_delta(delta) for x in self.args] 

2458 t = TensAdd(*args).doit() 

2459 return canon_bp(t) 

2460 

2461 def contract_metric(self, g): 

2462 """ 

2463 Raise or lower indices with the metric ``g`` 

2464 

2465 Parameters 

2466 ========== 

2467 

2468 g : metric 

2469 

2470 contract_all : if True, eliminate all ``g`` which are contracted 

2471 

2472 Notes 

2473 ===== 

2474 

2475 see the ``TensorIndexType`` docstring for the contraction conventions 

2476 """ 

2477 

2478 args = [contract_metric(x, g) for x in self.args] 

2479 t = TensAdd(*args).doit() 

2480 return canon_bp(t) 

2481 

2482 def fun_eval(self, *index_tuples): 

2483 """ 

2484 Return a tensor with free indices substituted according to ``index_tuples`` 

2485 

2486 Parameters 

2487 ========== 

2488 

2489 index_types : list of tuples ``(old_index, new_index)`` 

2490 

2491 Examples 

2492 ======== 

2493 

2494 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

2495 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dummy_fmt='L') 

2496 >>> i, j, k, l = tensor_indices('i,j,k,l', Lorentz) 

2497 >>> A, B = tensorhead('A,B', [Lorentz]*2, [[1]*2]) 

2498 >>> t = A(i, k)*B(-k, -j) + A(i, -j) 

2499 >>> t.fun_eval((i, k),(-j, l)) 

2500 A(k, L_0)*B(-L_0, l) + A(k, l) 

2501 """ 

2502 args = self.args 

2503 args1 = [] 

2504 for x in args: 

2505 y = x.fun_eval(*index_tuples) 

2506 args1.append(y) 

2507 return TensAdd(*args1).doit() 

2508 

2509 def substitute_indices(self, *index_tuples): 

2510 """ 

2511 Return a tensor with free indices substituted according to ``index_tuples`` 

2512 

2513 Parameters 

2514 ========== 

2515 

2516 index_types : list of tuples ``(old_index, new_index)`` 

2517 

2518 Examples 

2519 ======== 

2520 

2521 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

2522 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dummy_fmt='L') 

2523 >>> i, j, k, l = tensor_indices('i,j,k,l', Lorentz) 

2524 >>> A, B = tensorhead('A,B', [Lorentz]*2, [[1]*2]) 

2525 >>> t = A(i, k)*B(-k, -j); t 

2526 A(i, L_0)*B(-L_0, -j) 

2527 >>> t.substitute_indices((i,j), (j, k)) 

2528 A(j, L_0)*B(-L_0, -k) 

2529 """ 

2530 args = self.args 

2531 args1 = [] 

2532 for x in args: 

2533 y = x.substitute_indices(*index_tuples) 

2534 args1.append(y) 

2535 return TensAdd(*args1).doit() 

2536 

2537 def _print(self): 

2538 a = [] 

2539 args = self.args 

2540 for x in args: 

2541 a.append(str(x)) 

2542 a.sort() 

2543 s = ' + '.join(a) 

2544 s = s.replace('+ -', '- ') 

2545 return s 

2546 

2547 def _extract_data(self, replacement_dict): 

2548 from sympy.tensor.array import Array, permutedims 

2549 args_indices, arrays = zip(*[ 

2550 arg._extract_data(replacement_dict) if 

2551 isinstance(arg, TensExpr) else ([], arg) for arg in self.args 

2552 ]) 

2553 arrays = [Array(i) for i in arrays] 

2554 ref_indices = args_indices[0] 

2555 for i in range(1, len(args_indices)): 

2556 indices = args_indices[i] 

2557 array = arrays[i] 

2558 permutation = TensMul._get_indices_permutation(indices, ref_indices) 

2559 arrays[i] = permutedims(array, permutation) 

2560 return ref_indices, sum(arrays, Array.zeros(*array.shape)) 

2561 

2562 @property 

2563 def data(self): 

2564 deprecate_data() 

2565 return _tensor_data_substitution_dict[self.expand()]

2581 raise ValueError("No iteration on abstract tensors")

2588class Tensor(TensExpr): 

2589 """ 

2590 Base tensor class, i.e. this represents a tensor, the single unit to be 

2591 put into an expression. 

2592 

2593 This object is usually created from a ``TensorHead``, by attaching indices 

2594 to it. Indices preceded by a minus sign are considered contravariant, 

2595 otherwise covariant. 

2596 

2597 Examples 

2598 ======== 

2599 

2600 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

2601 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType("Lorentz", dummy_fmt="L") 

2602 >>> mu, nu = tensor_indices('mu nu', Lorentz) 

2603 >>> A = tensorhead("A", [Lorentz, Lorentz], [[1], [1]]) 

2604 >>> A(mu, -nu) 

2605 A(mu, -nu) 

2606 >>> A(mu, -mu) 

2607 A(L_0, -L_0) 

2608 

2609 """ 

2610 

2611 is_commutative = False 

2612 

2613 def __new__(cls, tensor_head, indices, **kw_args): 

2614 is_canon_bp = kw_args.pop('is_canon_bp', False) 

2615 indices = cls._parse_indices(tensor_head, indices) 

2616 obj = Basic.__new__(cls, tensor_head, Tuple(*indices), **kw_args) 

2617 obj._index_structure = _IndexStructure.from_indices(*indices) 

2618 obj._free_indices_set = set(obj._index_structure.get_free_indices()) 

2619 if tensor_head.rank != len(indices): 

2620 raise ValueError("wrong number of indices") 

2621 obj._indices = indices 

2622 obj._is_canon_bp = is_canon_bp 

2623 obj._index_map = Tensor._build_index_map(indices, obj._index_structure) 

2624 return obj 

2625 

2626 @staticmethod 

2627 def _build_index_map(indices, index_structure): 

2628 index_map = {} 

2629 for idx in indices: 

2630 index_map[idx] = (indices.index(idx),) 

2631 return index_map 

2632 

2633 def doit(self, **kwargs): 

2634 args, indices, free, dum = TensMul._tensMul_contract_indices([self]) 

2635 return args[0] 

2636 

2637 @staticmethod 

2638 def _parse_indices(tensor_head, indices): 

2639 if not isinstance(indices, (tuple, list, Tuple)): 

2640 raise TypeError("indices should be an array, got %s" % type(indices)) 

2641 indices = list(indices) 

2642 for i, index in enumerate(indices): 

2643 if isinstance(index, Symbol): 

2644 indices[i] = TensorIndex(index, tensor_head.index_types[i], True) 

2645 elif isinstance(index, Mul): 

2646 c, e = index.as_coeff_Mul() 

2647 if c == -1 and isinstance(e, Symbol): 

2648 indices[i] = TensorIndex(e, tensor_head.index_types[i], False) 

2649 else: 

2650 raise ValueError("index not understood: %s" % index) 

2651 elif not isinstance(index, TensorIndex): 

2652 raise TypeError("wrong type for index: %s is %s" % (index, type(index))) 

2653 return indices 

2654 

2655 def _set_new_index_structure(self, im, is_canon_bp=False): 

2656 indices = im.get_indices() 

2657 return self._set_indices(*indices, is_canon_bp=is_canon_bp) 

2658 

2659 def _set_indices(self, *indices, **kw_args): 

2660 if len(indices) != self.ext_rank: 

2661 raise ValueError("indices length mismatch") 

2662 return self.func(self.args[0], indices, is_canon_bp=kw_args.pop('is_canon_bp', False)).doit() 

2663 

2664 def _get_free_indices_set(self): 

2665 return set([i[0] for i in self._index_structure.free]) 

2666 

2667 def _get_dummy_indices_set(self): 

2668 dummy_pos = set(itertools.chain(*self._index_structure.dum)) 

2669 return set(idx for i, idx in enumerate(self.args[1]) if i in dummy_pos) 

2670 

2671 def _get_indices_set(self): 

2672 return set(self.args[1].args)

2700 return len(self.free)

2710 def commutes_with(self, other): 

2711 """ 

2712 :param other: 

2713 :return: 

2714 0 commute 

2715 1 anticommute 

2716 None neither commute nor anticommute 

2717 """ 

2718 if not isinstance(other, TensExpr): 

2719 return 0 

2720 elif isinstance(other, Tensor): 

2721 return self.component.commutes_with(other.component) 

2722 return NotImplementedError

2724 def perm2tensor(self, g, is_canon_bp=False): 

2725 """ 

2726 Returns the tensor corresponding to the permutation ``g`` 

2727 

2728 For further details, see the method in ``TIDS`` with the same name. 

2729 """ 

2730 return perm2tensor(self, g, is_canon_bp) 

2731 

2732 def canon_bp(self): 

2733 if self._is_canon_bp: 

2734 return self 

2735 expr = self.expand() 

2736 g, dummies, msym = expr._index_structure.indices_canon_args() 

2737 v = components_canon_args([expr.component]) 

2738 can = canonicalize(g, dummies, msym, *v) 

2739 if can == 0: 

2740 return S.Zero 

2741 tensor = self.perm2tensor(can, True) 

2742 return tensor

2790 

2791 def __call__(self, *indices): 

2792 """Returns tensor with ordered free indices replaced by ``indices`` 

2793 

2794 Examples 

2795 ======== 

2796 

2797 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

2798 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dummy_fmt='L') 

2799 >>> i0,i1,i2,i3,i4 = tensor_indices('i0:5', Lorentz) 

2800 >>> A = tensorhead('A', [Lorentz]*5, [[1]*5]) 

2801 >>> t = A(i2, i1, -i2, -i3, i4) 

2802 >>> t 

2803 A(L_0, i1, -L_0, -i3, i4) 

2804 >>> t(i1, i2, i3) 

2805 A(L_0, i1, -L_0, i2, i3) 

2806 """ 

2807 

2808 free_args = self.free_args 

2809 indices = list(indices) 

2810 if [x.tensor_index_type for x in indices] != [x.tensor_index_type for x in free_args]: 

2811 raise ValueError('incompatible types') 

2812 if indices == free_args: 

2813 return self 

2814 t = self.fun_eval(*list(zip(free_args, indices))) 

2815 

2816 # object is rebuilt in order to make sure that all contracted indices 

2817 # get recognized as dummies, but only if there are contracted indices. 

2818 if len(set(i if i.is_up else -i for i in indices)) != len(indices): 

2819 return t.func(*t.args) 

2820 return t 

2821 

2822 # TODO: put this into TensExpr? 

2823 def __iter__(self): 

2824 deprecate_data() 

2825 return self.data.__iter__() 

2826 

2827 # TODO: put this into TensExpr? 

2828 def __getitem__(self, item): 

2829 deprecate_data() 

2830 return self.data[item] 

2831 

2832 def _extract_data(self, replacement_dict): 

2833 from .array import Array 

2834 for k, v in replacement_dict.items(): 

2835 if isinstance(k, Tensor) and k.args[0] == self.args[0]: 

2836 other = k 

2837 array = v 

2838 break 

2839 else: 

2840 raise ValueError("%s not found in %s" % (self, replacement_dict)) 

2841 

2842 # TODO: inefficient, this should be done at root level only: 

2843 replacement_dict = {k: Array(v) for k, v in replacement_dict.items()} 

2844 array = Array(array) 

2845 

2846 dum1 = self.dum 

2847 dum2 = other.dum 

2848 

2849 if len(dum2) > 0: 

2850 for pair in dum2: 

2851 # allow `dum2` if the contained values are also in `dum1`. 

2852 if pair not in dum1: 

2853 raise NotImplementedError("%s with contractions is not implemented" % other) 

2854 # Remove elements in `dum2` from `dum1`: 

2855 dum1 = [pair for pair in dum1 if pair not in dum2] 

2856 if len(dum1) > 0: 

2857 indices2 = other.get_indices() 

2858 repl = {} 

2859 for p1, p2 in dum1: 

2860 repl[indices2[p2]] = -indices2[p1] 

2861 other = other.xreplace(repl).doit() 

2862 array = _TensorDataLazyEvaluator.data_contract_dum([array], dum1, len(indices2)) 

2863 

2864 free_ind1 = self.get_free_indices() 

2865 free_ind2 = other.get_free_indices() 

2866 

2867 return self._match_indices_with_other_tensor(array, free_ind1, free_ind2, replacement_dict)

2881 def data(self):

2883 if self in _tensor_data_substitution_dict: 

2884 del _tensor_data_substitution_dict[self] 

2885 if self.metric in _tensor_data_substitution_dict: 

2886 del _tensor_data_substitution_dict[self.metric]

2888 def _print(self): 

2889 indices = [str(ind) for ind in self.indices] 

2890 component = self.component 

2891 if component.rank > 0: 

2892 return ('%s(%s)' % (component.name, ', '.join(indices))) 

2893 else: 

2894 return ('%s' % component.name) 

2895 

2896 def equals(self, other): 

2897 if other == 0: 

2898 return self.coeff == 0 

2899 other = _sympify(other) 

2900 if not isinstance(other, TensExpr): 

2901 assert not self.components 

2902 return S.One == other 

2903 

2904 def _get_compar_comp(self): 

2905 t = self.canon_bp() 

2906 r = (t.coeff, tuple(t.components), \ 

2907 tuple(sorted(t.free)), tuple(sorted(t.dum))) 

2908 return r 

2909 

2910 return _get_compar_comp(self) == _get_compar_comp(other) 

2911 

2912 def contract_metric(self, g): 

2913 # if metric is not the same, ignore this step: 

2914 if self.component != g: 

2915 return self 

2916 # in case there are free components, do not perform anything: 

2917 if len(self.free) != 0: 

2918 return self 

2919 

2920 antisym = g.index_types[0].metric_antisym 

2921 sign = S.One 

2922 typ = g.index_types[0] 

2923 

2924 if not antisym: 

2925 # g(i, -i) 

2926 if typ._dim is None: 

2927 raise ValueError('dimension not assigned') 

2928 sign = sign*typ._dim 

2929 else: 

2930 # g(i, -i) 

2931 if typ._dim is None: 

2932 raise ValueError('dimension not assigned') 

2933 sign = sign*typ._dim 

2934 

2935 dp0, dp1 = self.dum[0] 

2936 if dp0 < dp1: 

2937 # g(i, -i) = -D with antisymmetric metric 

2938 sign = -sign 

2939 

2940 return sign 

2941 

2942 def contract_delta(self, metric): 

2943 return self.contract_metric(metric) 

2944 

2945 def _eval_rewrite_as_Indexed(self, tens, indices): 

2946 from sympy import Indexed 

2947 # TODO: replace .args[0] with .name: 

2948 index_symbols = [i.args[0] for i in self.get_indices()] 

2949 expr = Indexed(tens.args[0], *index_symbols) 

2950 return self._check_add_Sum(expr, index_symbols)

2953class TensMul(TensExpr, AssocOp): 

2954 """ 

2955 Product of tensors 

2956 

2957 Parameters 

2958 ========== 

2959 

2960 coeff : SymPy coefficient of the tensor 

2961 args 

2962 

2963 Attributes 

2964 ========== 

2965 

2966 ``components`` : list of ``TensorHead`` of the component tensors 

2967 ``types`` : list of nonrepeated ``TensorIndexType`` 

2968 ``free`` : list of ``(ind, ipos, icomp)``, see Notes 

2969 ``dum`` : list of ``(ipos1, ipos2, icomp1, icomp2)``, see Notes 

2970 ``ext_rank`` : rank of the tensor counting the dummy indices 

2971 ``rank`` : rank of the tensor 

2972 ``coeff`` : SymPy coefficient of the tensor 

2973 ``free_args`` : list of the free indices in sorted order 

2974 ``is_canon_bp`` : ``True`` if the tensor in in canonical form 

2975 

2976 Notes 

2977 ===== 

2978 

2979 ``args[0]`` list of ``TensorHead`` of the component tensors. 

2980 

2981 ``args[1]`` list of ``(ind, ipos, icomp)`` 

2982 where ``ind`` is a free index, ``ipos`` is the slot position 

2983 of ``ind`` in the ``icomp``-th component tensor. 

2984 

2985 ``args[2]`` list of tuples representing dummy indices. 

2986 ``(ipos1, ipos2, icomp1, icomp2)`` indicates that the contravariant 

2987 dummy index is the ``ipos1``-th slot position in the ``icomp1``-th 

2988 component tensor; the corresponding covariant index is 

2989 in the ``ipos2`` slot position in the ``icomp2``-th component tensor. 

2990 

2991 """ 

2992 identity = S.One 

2993 

2994 def __new__(cls, *args, **kw_args): 

2995 is_canon_bp = kw_args.get('is_canon_bp', False) 

2996 args = list(map(_sympify, args)) 

2997 

2998 # Flatten: 

2999 args = [i for arg in args for i in (arg.args if isinstance(arg, (TensMul, Mul)) else [arg])] 

3000 

3001 args, indices, free, dum = TensMul._tensMul_contract_indices(args, replace_indices=False) 

3002 

3003 # Data for indices: 

3004 index_types = [i.tensor_index_type for i in indices] 

3005 index_structure = _IndexStructure(free, dum, index_types, indices, canon_bp=is_canon_bp) 

3006 

3007 obj = TensExpr.__new__(cls, *args) 

3008 obj._indices = indices 

3009 obj._index_types = index_types 

3010 obj._index_structure = index_structure 

3011 obj._ext_rank = len(obj._index_structure.free) + 2*len(obj._index_structure.dum) 

3012 obj._coeff = S.One 

3013 obj._is_canon_bp = is_canon_bp 

3014 return obj 

3015 

3016 @staticmethod 

3017 def _indices_to_free_dum(args_indices): 

3018 free2pos1 = {} 

3019 free2pos2 = {} 

3020 dummy_data = [] 

3021 indices = [] 

3022 

3023 # Notation for positions (to better understand the code): 

3024 # `pos1`: position in the `args`. 

3025 # `pos2`: position in the indices. 

3026 

3027 # Example: 

3028 # A(i, j)*B(k, m, n)*C(p) 

3029 # `pos1` of `n` is 1 because it's in `B` (second `args` of TensMul). 

3030 # `pos2` of `n` is 4 because it's the fifth overall index. 

3031 

3032 # Counter for the index position wrt the whole expression: 

3033 pos2 = 0 

3034 

3035 for pos1, arg_indices in enumerate(args_indices): 

3036 

3037 for index_pos, index in enumerate(arg_indices): 

3038 if not isinstance(index, TensorIndex): 

3039 raise TypeError("expected TensorIndex") 

3040 if -index in free2pos1: 

3041 # Dummy index detected: 

3042 other_pos1 = free2pos1.pop(-index) 

3043 other_pos2 = free2pos2.pop(-index) 

3044 if index.is_up: 

3045 dummy_data.append((index, pos1, other_pos1, pos2, other_pos2)) 

3046 else: 

3047 dummy_data.append((-index, other_pos1, pos1, other_pos2, pos2)) 

3048 indices.append(index) 

3049 elif index in free2pos1: 

3050 raise ValueError("Repeated index: %s" % index) 

3051 else: 

3052 free2pos1[index] = pos1 

3053 free2pos2[index] = pos2 

3054 indices.append(index) 

3055 pos2 += 1 

3056 

3057 free = [(i, p) for (i, p) in free2pos2.items()] 

3058 free_names = [i.name for i in free2pos2.keys()] 

3059 

3060 dummy_data.sort(key=lambda x: x[3]) 

3061 return indices, free, free_names, dummy_data 

3062 

3063 @staticmethod 

3064 def _dummy_data_to_dum(dummy_data): 

3065 return [(p2a, p2b) for (i, p1a, p1b, p2a, p2b) in dummy_data] 

3066 

3067 @staticmethod 

3068 def _tensMul_contract_indices(args, replace_indices=True): 

3069 replacements = [{} for _ in args] 

3070 

3071 #_index_order = all([_has_index_order(arg) for arg in args]) 

3072 

3073 args_indices = [get_indices(arg) for arg in args] 

3074 indices, free, free_names, dummy_data = TensMul._indices_to_free_dum(args_indices) 

3075 

3076 cdt = defaultdict(int) 

3077 

3078 def dummy_fmt_gen(tensor_index_type): 

3079 fmt = tensor_index_type.dummy_fmt 

3080 nd = cdt[tensor_index_type] 

3081 cdt[tensor_index_type] += 1 

3082 return fmt % nd 

3083 

3084 if replace_indices: 

3085 for old_index, pos1cov, pos1contra, pos2cov, pos2contra in dummy_data: 

3086 index_type = old_index.tensor_index_type 

3087 while True: 

3088 dummy_name = dummy_fmt_gen(index_type) 

3089 if dummy_name not in free_names: 

3090 break 

3091 dummy = TensorIndex(dummy_name, index_type, True) 

3092 replacements[pos1cov][old_index] = dummy 

3093 replacements[pos1contra][-old_index] = -dummy 

3094 indices[pos2cov] = dummy 

3095 indices[pos2contra] = -dummy 

3096 args = [arg.xreplace(repl) for arg, repl in zip(args, replacements)] 

3097 

3098 dum = TensMul._dummy_data_to_dum(dummy_data) 

3099 return args, indices, free, dum 

3100 

3101 @staticmethod 

3102 def _get_components_from_args(args): 

3103 """ 

3104 Get a list of ``Tensor`` objects having the same ``TIDS`` if multiplied 

3105 by one another. 

3106 """ 

3107 components = [] 

3108 for arg in args: 

3109 if not isinstance(arg, TensExpr): 

3110 continue 

3111 if isinstance(arg, TensAdd): 

3112 continue 

3113 components.extend(arg.components) 

3114 return components 

3115 

3116 @staticmethod 

3117 def _rebuild_tensors_list(args, index_structure): 

3118 indices = index_structure.get_indices() 

3119 #tensors = [None for i in components] # pre-allocate list 

3120 ind_pos = 0 

3121 for i, arg in enumerate(args): 

3122 if not isinstance(arg, TensExpr): 

3123 continue 

3124 prev_pos = ind_pos 

3125 ind_pos += arg.ext_rank 

3126 args[i] = Tensor(arg.component, indices[prev_pos:ind_pos]) 

3127 

3128 def doit(self, **kwargs): 

3129 is_canon_bp = self._is_canon_bp 

3130 deep = kwargs.get('deep', True) 

3131 if deep: 

3132 args = [arg.doit(**kwargs) for arg in self.args] 

3133 else: 

3134 args = self.args 

3135 

3136 args = [arg for arg in args if arg != self.identity] 

3137 

3138 # Extract non-tensor coefficients: 

3139 coeff = reduce(lambda a, b: a*b, [arg for arg in args if not isinstance(arg, TensExpr)], S.One) 

3140 args = [arg for arg in args if isinstance(arg, TensExpr)] 

3141 

3142 if len(args) == 0: 

3143 return coeff 

3144 

3145 if coeff != self.identity: 

3146 args = [coeff] + args 

3147 if coeff == 0: 

3148 return S.Zero 

3149 

3150 if len(args) == 1: 

3151 return args[0] 

3152 

3153 args, indices, free, dum = TensMul._tensMul_contract_indices(args) 

3154 

3155 # Data for indices: 

3156 index_types = [i.tensor_index_type for i in indices] 

3157 index_structure = _IndexStructure(free, dum, index_types, indices, canon_bp=is_canon_bp) 

3158 

3159 obj = self.func(*args) 

3160 obj._index_types = index_types 

3161 obj._index_structure = index_structure 

3162 obj._ext_rank = len(obj._index_structure.free) + 2*len(obj._index_structure.dum) 

3163 obj._coeff = coeff 

3164 obj._is_canon_bp = is_canon_bp 

3165 return obj

3173 @staticmethod 

3174 def _get_tensors_from_components_free_dum(components, free, dum): 

3175 """ 

3176 Get a list of ``Tensor`` objects by distributing ``free`` and ``dum`` indices on the ``components``. 

3177 """ 

3178 index_structure = _IndexStructure.from_components_free_dum(components, free, dum) 

3179 indices = index_structure.get_indices() 

3180 tensors = [None for i in components] # pre-allocate list 

3181 

3182 # distribute indices on components to build a list of tensors: 

3183 ind_pos = 0 

3184 for i, component in enumerate(components): 

3185 prev_pos = ind_pos 

3186 ind_pos += component.rank 

3187 tensors[i] = Tensor(component, indices[prev_pos:ind_pos]) 

3188 return tensors 

3189 

3190 def _get_free_indices_set(self): 

3191 return set([i[0] for i in self.free]) 

3192 

3193 def _get_dummy_indices_set(self): 

3194 dummy_pos = set(itertools.chain(*self.dum)) 

3195 return set(idx for i, idx in enumerate(self._index_structure.get_indices()) if i in dummy_pos) 

3196 

3197 def _get_position_offset_for_indices(self): 

3198 arg_offset = [None for i in range(self.ext_rank)] 

3199 counter = 0 

3200 for i, arg in enumerate(self.args): 

3201 if not isinstance(arg, TensExpr): 

3202 continue 

3203 for j in range(arg.ext_rank): 

3204 arg_offset[j + counter] = counter 

3205 counter += arg.ext_rank 

3206 return arg_offset 

3207 

3208 @property 

3209 def free_args(self): 

3210 return sorted([x[0] for x in self.free]) 

3211 

3212 @property 

3213 def components(self): 

3214 return self._get_components_from_args(self.args) 

3215 

3216 @property 

3217 def free(self): 

3218 return self._index_structure.free[:] 

3219 

3220 @property 

3221 def free_in_args(self): 

3222 arg_offset = self._get_position_offset_for_indices() 

3223 argpos = self._get_indices_to_args_pos() 

3224 return [(ind, pos-arg_offset[pos], argpos[pos]) for (ind, pos) in self.free] 

3225 

3226 @property 

3227 def coeff(self): 

3228 return self._coeff 

3229 

3230 @property 

3231 def nocoeff(self): 

3232 return self.func(*[t for t in self.args if isinstance(t, TensExpr)]).doit() 

3233 

3234 @property 

3235 def dum(self): 

3236 return self._index_structure.dum[:] 

3237 

3238 @property 

3239 def dum_in_args(self): 

3240 arg_offset = self._get_position_offset_for_indices() 

3241 argpos = self._get_indices_to_args_pos() 

3242 return [(p1-arg_offset[p1], p2-arg_offset[p2], argpos[p1], argpos[p2]) for p1, p2 in self.dum] 

3243 

3244 @property 

3245 def rank(self): 

3246 return len(self.free) 

3247 

3248 @property 

3249 def ext_rank(self): 

3250 return self._ext_rank 

3251 

3252 @property 

3253 def index_types(self): 

3254 return self._index_types[:] 

3255 

3256 def equals(self, other): 

3257 if other == 0: 

3258 return self.coeff == 0 

3259 other = _sympify(other) 

3260 if not isinstance(other, TensExpr): 

3261 assert not self.components 

3262 return self._coeff == other 

3263 

3264 return self.canon_bp() == other.canon_bp() 

3265 

3266 def get_indices(self): 

3267 """ 

3268 Returns the list of indices of the tensor 

3269 

3270 The indices are listed in the order in which they appear in the 

3271 component tensors. 

3272 The dummy indices are given a name which does not collide with 

3273 the names of the free indices. 

3274 

3275 Examples 

3276 ======== 

3277 

3278 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

3279 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dummy_fmt='L') 

3280 >>> m0, m1, m2 = tensor_indices('m0,m1,m2', Lorentz) 

3281 >>> g = Lorentz.metric 

3282 >>> p, q = tensorhead('p,q', [Lorentz], [[1]]) 

3283 >>> t = p(m1)*g(m0,m2) 

3284 >>> t.get_indices() 

3285 [m1, m0, m2] 

3286 >>> t2 = p(m1)*g(-m1, m2) 

3287 >>> t2.get_indices() 

3288 [L_0, -L_0, m2] 

3289 """ 

3290 return self._indices 

3291 

3292 def get_free_indices(self): 

3293 """ 

3294 Returns the list of free indices of the tensor 

3295 

3296 The indices are listed in the order in which they appear in the 

3297 component tensors. 

3298 

3299 Examples 

3300 ======== 

3301 

3302 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

3303 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dummy_fmt='L') 

3304 >>> m0, m1, m2 = tensor_indices('m0,m1,m2', Lorentz) 

3305 >>> g = Lorentz.metric 

3306 >>> p, q = tensorhead('p,q', [Lorentz], [[1]]) 

3307 >>> t = p(m1)*g(m0,m2) 

3308 >>> t.get_free_indices() 

3309 [m1, m0, m2] 

3310 >>> t2 = p(m1)*g(-m1, m2) 

3311 >>> t2.get_free_indices() 

3312 [m2] 

3313 """ 

3314 return self._index_structure.get_free_indices() 

3315 

3316 def split(self): 

3317 """ 

3318 Returns a list of tensors, whose product is ``self`` 

3319 

3320 Dummy indices contracted among different tensor components 

3321 become free indices with the same name as the one used to 

3322 represent the dummy indices. 

3323 

3324 Examples 

3325 ======== 

3326 

3327 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

3328 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dummy_fmt='L') 

3329 >>> a, b, c, d = tensor_indices('a,b,c,d', Lorentz) 

3330 >>> A, B = tensorhead('A,B', [Lorentz]*2, [[1]*2]) 

3331 >>> t = A(a,b)*B(-b,c) 

3332 >>> t 

3333 A(a, L_0)*B(-L_0, c) 

3334 >>> t.split() 

3335 [A(a, L_0), B(-L_0, c)] 

3336 """ 

3337 if self.args == (): 

3338 return [self] 

3339 splitp = [] 

3340 res = 1 

3341 for arg in self.args: 

3342 if isinstance(arg, Tensor): 

3343 splitp.append(res*arg) 

3344 res = 1 

3345 else: 

3346 res *= arg 

3347 return splitp 

3348 

3349 def _expand(self, **hints): 

3350 # TODO: temporary solution, in the future this should be linked to 

3351 # `Expr.expand`. 

3352 args = [_expand(arg, **hints) for arg in self.args] 

3353 args1 = [arg.args if isinstance(arg, (Add, TensAdd)) else (arg,) for arg in args] 

3354 return TensAdd(*[ 

3355 TensMul(*i) for i in itertools.product(*args1)] 

3356 ) 

3357 

3358 def __neg__(self): 

3359 return TensMul(S.NegativeOne, self, is_canon_bp=self._is_canon_bp).doit() 

3360 

3361 def __getitem__(self, item): 

3362 deprecate_data() 

3363 return self.data[item] 

3364 

3365 def _get_args_for_traditional_printer(self): 

3366 args = list(self.args) 

3367 if (self.coeff < 0) == True: 

3368 # expressions like "-A(a)" 

3369 sign = "-" 

3370 if self.coeff == S.NegativeOne: 

3371 args = args[1:] 

3372 else: 

3373 args[0] = -args[0] 

3374 else: 

3375 sign = "" 

3376 return sign, args 

3377 

3378 def _sort_args_for_sorted_components(self): 

3379 """ 

3380 Returns the ``args`` sorted according to the components commutation 

3381 properties. 

3382 

3383 The sorting is done taking into account the commutation group 

3384 of the component tensors. 

3385 """ 

3386 cv = [arg for arg in self.args if isinstance(arg, TensExpr)] 

3387 sign = 1 

3388 n = len(cv) - 1 

3389 for i in range(n): 

3390 for j in range(n, i, -1): 

3391 c = cv[j-1].commutes_with(cv[j]) 

3392 # if `c` is `None`, it does neither commute nor anticommute, skip: 

3393 if c not in [0, 1]: 

3394 continue 

3395 if (cv[j-1].component.types, cv[j-1].component.name) > \ 

3396 (cv[j].component.types, cv[j].component.name): 

3397 cv[j-1], cv[j] = cv[j], cv[j-1] 

3398 # if `c` is 1, the anticommute, so change sign: 

3399 if c: 

3400 sign = -sign 

3401 

3402 coeff = sign * self.coeff 

3403 if coeff != 1: 

3404 return [coeff] + cv 

3405 return cv 

3406 

3407 def sorted_components(self): 

3408 """ 

3409 Returns a tensor product with sorted components. 

3410 """ 

3411 return TensMul(*self._sort_args_for_sorted_components()).doit() 

3412 

3413 def perm2tensor(self, g, is_canon_bp=False): 

3414 """ 

3415 Returns the tensor corresponding to the permutation ``g`` 

3416 

3417 For further details, see the method in ``TIDS`` with the same name. 

3418 """ 

3419 return perm2tensor(self, g, is_canon_bp=is_canon_bp) 

3420 

3421 def canon_bp(self): 

3422 """ 

3423 Canonicalize using the Butler-Portugal algorithm for canonicalization 

3424 under monoterm symmetries. 

3425 

3426 Examples 

3427 ======== 

3428 

3429 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

3430 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dummy_fmt='L') 

3431 >>> m0, m1, m2 = tensor_indices('m0,m1,m2', Lorentz) 

3432 >>> A = tensorhead('A', [Lorentz]*2, [[2]]) 

3433 >>> t = A(m0,-m1)*A(m1,-m0) 

3434 >>> t.canon_bp() 

3435 -A(L_0, L_1)*A(-L_0, -L_1) 

3436 >>> t = A(m0,-m1)*A(m1,-m2)*A(m2,-m0) 

3437 >>> t.canon_bp() 

3438 0 

3439 """ 

3440 if self._is_canon_bp: 

3441 return self 

3442 expr = self.expand() 

3443 if isinstance(expr, TensAdd): 

3444 return expr.canon_bp() 

3445 if not expr.components: 

3446 return expr 

3447 t = expr.sorted_components() 

3448 g, dummies, msym = t._index_structure.indices_canon_args() 

3449 v = components_canon_args(t.components) 

3450 can = canonicalize(g, dummies, msym, *v) 

3451 if can == 0: 

3452 return S.Zero 

3453 tmul = t.perm2tensor(can, True) 

3454 return tmul 

3455 

3456 def contract_delta(self, delta): 

3457 t = self.contract_metric(delta) 

3458 return t 

3459 

3460 def _get_indices_to_args_pos(self): 

3461 """ 

3462 Get a dict mapping the index position to TensMul's argument number. 

3463 """ 

3464 pos_map = dict() 

3465 pos_counter = 0 

3466 for arg_i, arg in enumerate(self.args): 

3467 if not isinstance(arg, TensExpr): 

3468 continue 

3469 assert isinstance(arg, Tensor) 

3470 for i in range(arg.ext_rank): 

3471 pos_map[pos_counter] = arg_i 

3472 pos_counter += 1 

3473 return pos_map 

3474 

3475 def contract_metric(self, g): 

3476 """ 

3477 Raise or lower indices with the metric ``g`` 

3478 

3479 Parameters 

3480 ========== 

3481 

3482 g : metric 

3483 

3484 Notes 

3485 ===== 

3486 

3487 see the ``TensorIndexType`` docstring for the contraction conventions 

3488 

3489 Examples 

3490 ======== 

3491 

3492 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

3493 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dummy_fmt='L') 

3494 >>> m0, m1, m2 = tensor_indices('m0,m1,m2', Lorentz) 

3495 >>> g = Lorentz.metric 

3496 >>> p, q = tensorhead('p,q', [Lorentz], [[1]]) 

3497 >>> t = p(m0)*q(m1)*g(-m0, -m1) 

3498 >>> t.canon_bp() 

3499 metric(L_0, L_1)*p(-L_0)*q(-L_1) 

3500 >>> t.contract_metric(g).canon_bp() 

3501 p(L_0)*q(-L_0) 

3502 """ 

3503 expr = self.expand() 

3504 if self != expr: 

3505 expr = expr.canon_bp() 

3506 return expr.contract_metric(g) 

3507 pos_map = self._get_indices_to_args_pos() 

3508 args = list(self.args) 

3509 

3510 antisym = g.index_types[0].metric_antisym 

3511 

3512 # list of positions of the metric ``g`` inside ``args`` 

3513 gpos = [i for i, x in enumerate(self.args) if isinstance(x, Tensor) and x.component == g] 

3514 if not gpos: 

3515 return self 

3516 

3517 # Sign is either 1 or -1, to correct the sign after metric contraction 

3518 # (for spinor indices). 

3519 sign = 1 

3520 dum = self.dum[:] 

3521 free = self.free[:] 

3522 elim = set() 

3523 for gposx in gpos: 

3524 if gposx in elim: 

3525 continue 

3526 free1 = [x for x in free if pos_map[x[1]] == gposx] 

3527 dum1 = [x for x in dum if pos_map[x[0]] == gposx or pos_map[x[1]] == gposx] 

3528 if not dum1: 

3529 continue 

3530 elim.add(gposx) 

3531 # subs with the multiplication neutral element, that is, remove it: 

3532 args[gposx] = 1 

3533 if len(dum1) == 2: 

3534 if not antisym: 

3535 dum10, dum11 = dum1 

3536 if pos_map[dum10[1]] == gposx: 

3537 # the index with pos p0 contravariant 

3538 p0 = dum10[0] 

3539 else: 

3540 # the index with pos p0 is covariant 

3541 p0 = dum10[1] 

3542 if pos_map[dum11[1]] == gposx: 

3543 # the index with pos p1 is contravariant 

3544 p1 = dum11[0] 

3545 else: 

3546 # the index with pos p1 is covariant 

3547 p1 = dum11[1] 

3548 

3549 dum.append((p0, p1)) 

3550 else: 

3551 dum10, dum11 = dum1 

3552 # change the sign to bring the indices of the metric to contravariant 

3553 # form; change the sign if dum10 has the metric index in position 0 

3554 if pos_map[dum10[1]] == gposx: 

3555 # the index with pos p0 is contravariant 

3556 p0 = dum10[0] 

3557 if dum10[1] == 1: 

3558 sign = -sign 

3559 else: 

3560 # the index with pos p0 is covariant 

3561 p0 = dum10[1] 

3562 if dum10[0] == 0: 

3563 sign = -sign 

3564 if pos_map[dum11[1]] == gposx: 

3565 # the index with pos p1 is contravariant 

3566 p1 = dum11[0] 

3567 sign = -sign 

3568 else: 

3569 # the index with pos p1 is covariant 

3570 p1 = dum11[1] 

3571 

3572 dum.append((p0, p1)) 

3573 

3574 elif len(dum1) == 1: 

3575 if not antisym: 

3576 dp0, dp1 = dum1[0] 

3577 if pos_map[dp0] == pos_map[dp1]: 

3578 # g(i, -i) 

3579 typ = g.index_types[0] 

3580 if typ._dim is None: 

3581 raise ValueError('dimension not assigned') 

3582 sign = sign*typ._dim 

3583 

3584 else: 

3585 # g(i0, i1)*p(-i1) 

3586 if pos_map[dp0] == gposx: 

3587 p1 = dp1 

3588 else: 

3589 p1 = dp0 

3590 

3591 ind, p = free1[0] 

3592 free.append((ind, p1)) 

3593 else: 

3594 dp0, dp1 = dum1[0] 

3595 if pos_map[dp0] == pos_map[dp1]: 

3596 # g(i, -i) 

3597 typ = g.index_types[0] 

3598 if typ._dim is None: 

3599 raise ValueError('dimension not assigned') 

3600 sign = sign*typ._dim 

3601 

3602 if dp0 < dp1: 

3603 # g(i, -i) = -D with antisymmetric metric 

3604 sign = -sign 

3605 else: 

3606 # g(i0, i1)*p(-i1) 

3607 if pos_map[dp0] == gposx: 

3608 p1 = dp1 

3609 if dp0 == 0: 

3610 sign = -sign 

3611 else: 

3612 p1 = dp0 

3613 ind, p = free1[0] 

3614 free.append((ind, p1)) 

3615 dum = [x for x in dum if x not in dum1] 

3616 free = [x for x in free if x not in free1] 

3617 

3618 # shift positions: 

3619 shift = 0 

3620 shifts = [0]*len(args) 

3621 for i in range(len(args)): 

3622 if i in elim: 

3623 shift += 2 

3624 continue 

3625 shifts[i] = shift 

3626 free = [(ind, p - shifts[pos_map[p]]) for (ind, p) in free if pos_map[p] not in elim] 

3627 dum = [(p0 - shifts[pos_map[p0]], p1 - shifts[pos_map[p1]]) for i, (p0, p1) in enumerate(dum) if pos_map[p0] not in elim and pos_map[p1] not in elim] 

3628 

3629 res = sign*TensMul(*args).doit() 

3630 if not isinstance(res, TensExpr): 

3631 return res 

3632 im = _IndexStructure.from_components_free_dum(res.components, free, dum) 

3633 return res._set_new_index_structure(im) 

3634 

3635 def _set_new_index_structure(self, im, is_canon_bp=False): 

3636 indices = im.get_indices() 

3637 return self._set_indices(*indices, is_canon_bp=is_canon_bp) 

3638 

3639 def _set_indices(self, *indices, **kw_args): 

3640 if len(indices) != self.ext_rank: 

3641 raise ValueError("indices length mismatch") 

3642 args = list(self.args)[:] 

3643 pos = 0 

3644 is_canon_bp = kw_args.pop('is_canon_bp', False) 

3645 for i, arg in enumerate(args): 

3646 if not isinstance(arg, TensExpr): 

3647 continue 

3648 assert isinstance(arg, Tensor) 

3649 ext_rank = arg.ext_rank 

3650 args[i] = arg._set_indices(*indices[pos:pos+ext_rank]) 

3651 pos += ext_rank 

3652 return TensMul(*args, is_canon_bp=is_canon_bp).doit()

3654 @staticmethod 

3655 def _index_replacement_for_contract_metric(args, free, dum): 

3656 for arg in args: 

3657 if not isinstance(arg, TensExpr): 

3658 continue 

3659 assert isinstance(arg, Tensor) 

3660 

3661 def substitute_indices(self, *index_tuples): 

3662 return substitute_indices(self, *index_tuples) 

3663 

3664 def __call__(self, *indices): 

3665 """Returns tensor product with ordered free indices replaced by ``indices`` 

3666 

3667 Examples 

3668 ======== 

3669 

3670 >>> from sympy import Symbol 

3671 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

3672 >>> D = Symbol('D') 

3673 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dim=D, dummy_fmt='L') 

3674 >>> i0,i1,i2,i3,i4 = tensor_indices('i0:5', Lorentz) 

3675 >>> g = Lorentz.metric 

3676 >>> p, q = tensorhead('p,q', [Lorentz], [[1]]) 

3677 >>> t = p(i0)*q(i1)*q(-i1) 

3678 >>> t(i1) 

3679 p(i1)*q(L_0)*q(-L_0) 

3680 """ 

3681 free_args = self.free_args 

3682 indices = list(indices) 

3683 if [x.tensor_index_type for x in indices] != [x.tensor_index_type for x in free_args]: 

3684 raise ValueError('incompatible types') 

3685 if indices == free_args: 

3686 return self 

3687 t = self.fun_eval(*list(zip(free_args, indices))) 

3688 

3689 # object is rebuilt in order to make sure that all contracted indices 

3690 # get recognized as dummies, but only if there are contracted indices. 

3691 if len(set(i if i.is_up else -i for i in indices)) != len(indices): 

3692 return t.func(*t.args) 

3693 return t 

3694 

3695 def _extract_data(self, replacement_dict): 

3696 args_indices, arrays = zip(*[arg._extract_data(replacement_dict) for arg in self.args if isinstance(arg, TensExpr)]) 

3697 coeff = reduce(operator.mul, [a for a in self.args if not isinstance(a, TensExpr)], S.One) 

3698 indices, free, free_names, dummy_data = TensMul._indices_to_free_dum(args_indices) 

3699 dum = TensMul._dummy_data_to_dum(dummy_data) 

3700 ext_rank = self.ext_rank 

3701 free.sort(key=lambda x: x[1]) 

3702 free_indices = [i[0] for i in free] 

3703 return free_indices, coeff*_TensorDataLazyEvaluator.data_contract_dum(arrays, dum, ext_rank) 

3704

3708 dat = _tensor_data_substitution_dict[self.expand()] 

3709 return dat

3724 raise ValueError("No iteration on abstract tensors")

3727 def _eval_rewrite_as_Indexed(self, *args): 

3728 from sympy import Sum 

3729 index_symbols = [i.args[0] for i in self.get_indices()] 

3730 args = [arg.args[0] if isinstance(arg, Sum) else arg for arg in args] 

3731 expr = Mul.fromiter(args) 

3732 return self._check_add_Sum(expr, index_symbols)

3734 

3735class TensorElement(TensExpr): 

3736 """ 

3737 Tensor with evaluated components. 

3738 

3739 Examples 

3740 ======== 

3741 

3742 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensorhead 

3743 >>> from sympy import symbols 

3744 >>> L = TensorIndexType("L") 

3745 >>> i, j, k = symbols("i j k") 

3746 >>> A = tensorhead("A", [L, L], [[1], [1]]) 

3747 >>> A(i, j).get_free_indices() 

3748 [i, j] 

3749 

3750 If we want to set component ``i`` to a specific value, use the 

3751 ``TensorElement`` class: 

3752 

3753 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorElement 

3754 >>> te = TensorElement(A(i, j), {i: 2}) 

3755 

3756 As index ``i`` has been accessed (``{i: 2}`` is the evaluation of its 3rd 

3757 element), the free indices will only contain ``j``: 

3758 

3759 >>> te.get_free_indices() 

3760 [j] 

3761 """ 

3762 

3763 def __new__(cls, expr, index_map): 

3764 if not isinstance(expr, Tensor): 

3765 # remap 

3766 if not isinstance(expr, TensExpr): 

3767 raise TypeError("%s is not a tensor expression" % expr) 

3768 return expr.func(*[TensorElement(arg, index_map) for arg in expr.args]) 

3769 expr_free_indices = expr.get_free_indices() 

3770 name_translation = {i.args[0]: i for i in expr_free_indices} 

3771 index_map = {name_translation.get(index, index): value for index, value in index_map.items()} 

3772 index_map = {index: value for index, value in index_map.items() if index in expr_free_indices} 

3773 if len(index_map) == 0: 

3774 return expr 

3775 free_indices = [i for i in expr_free_indices if i not in index_map.keys()] 

3776 index_map = Dict(index_map) 

3777 obj = TensExpr.__new__(cls, expr, index_map) 

3778 obj._free_indices = free_indices 

3779 return obj 

3780 

3781 @property 

3782 def free(self): 

3783 return [(index, i) for i, index in enumerate(self.get_free_indices())] 

3784 

3785 @property 

3786 def dum(self): 

3787 # TODO: inherit dummies from expr 

3788 return [] 

3789 

3790 @property 

3791 def expr(self): 

3792 return self._args[0] 

3793 

3794 @property 

3795 def index_map(self): 

3796 return self._args[1] 

3797 

3798 def get_free_indices(self): 

3799 return self._free_indices 

3800 

3801 def get_indices(self): 

3802 return self.get_free_indices() 

3803 

3804 def _extract_data(self, replacement_dict): 

3805 ret_indices, array = self.expr._extract_data(replacement_dict) 

3806 index_map = self.index_map 

3807 slice_tuple = tuple(index_map.get(i, slice(None)) for i in ret_indices) 

3808 ret_indices = [i for i in ret_indices if i not in index_map] 

3809 array = array.__getitem__(slice_tuple) 

3810 return ret_indices, array

3813def canon_bp(p): 

3814 """ 

3815 Butler-Portugal canonicalization 

3816 """ 

3817 if isinstance(p, TensExpr): 

3818 return p.canon_bp() 

3819 return p 

3820 

3821def tensor_mul(*a): 

3822 """ 

3823 product of tensors 

3824 """ 

3825 if not a: 

3826 return TensMul.from_data(S.One, [], [], []) 

3827 t = a[0] 

3828 for tx in a[1:]: 

3829 t = t*tx 

3830 return t 

3831 

3832 

3833def riemann_cyclic_replace(t_r): 

3834 """ 

3835 replace Riemann tensor with an equivalent expression 

3836 

3837 ``R(m,n,p,q) -> 2/3*R(m,n,p,q) - 1/3*R(m,q,n,p) + 1/3*R(m,p,n,q)`` 

3838 

3839 """ 

3840 free = sorted(t_r.free, key=lambda x: x[1]) 

3841 m, n, p, q = [x[0] for x in free] 

3842 t0 = S(2)/3*t_r 

3843 t1 = - S(1)/3*t_r.substitute_indices((m,m),(n,q),(p,n),(q,p)) 

3844 t2 = S(1)/3*t_r.substitute_indices((m,m),(n,p),(p,n),(q,q)) 

3845 t3 = t0 + t1 + t2 

3846 return t3 

3847 

3848def riemann_cyclic(t2): 

3849 """ 

3850 replace each Riemann tensor with an equivalent expression 

3851 satisfying the cyclic identity. 

3852 

3853 This trick is discussed in the reference guide to Cadabra. 

3854 

3855 Examples 

3856 ======== 

3857 

3858 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead, riemann_cyclic 

3859 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dummy_fmt='L') 

3860 >>> i, j, k, l = tensor_indices('i,j,k,l', Lorentz) 

3861 >>> R = tensorhead('R', [Lorentz]*4, [[2, 2]]) 

3862 >>> t = R(i,j,k,l)*(R(-i,-j,-k,-l) - 2*R(-i,-k,-j,-l)) 

3863 >>> riemann_cyclic(t) 

3864 0 

3865 """ 

3866 t2 = t2.expand() 

3867 if isinstance(t2, (TensMul, Tensor)): 

3868 args = [t2] 

3869 else: 

3870 args = t2.args 

3871 a1 = [x.split() for x in args] 

3872 a2 = [[riemann_cyclic_replace(tx) for tx in y] for y in a1] 

3873 a3 = [tensor_mul(*v) for v in a2] 

3874 t3 = TensAdd(*a3).doit() 

3875 if not t3: 

3876 return t3 

3877 else: 

3878 return canon_bp(t3) 

3879 

3880 

3881def get_lines(ex, index_type): 

3882 """ 

3883 returns ``(lines, traces, rest)`` for an index type, 

3884 where ``lines`` is the list of list of positions of a matrix line, 

3885 ``traces`` is the list of list of traced matrix lines, 

3886 ``rest`` is the rest of the elements ot the tensor. 

3887 """ 

3888 def _join_lines(a): 

3889 i = 0 

3890 while i < len(a): 

3891 x = a[i] 

3892 xend = x[-1] 

3893 xstart = x[0] 

3894 hit = True 

3895 while hit: 

3896 hit = False 

3897 for j in range(i + 1, len(a)): 

3898 if j >= len(a): 

3899 break 

3900 if a[j][0] == xend: 

3901 hit = True 

3902 x.extend(a[j][1:]) 

3903 xend = x[-1] 

3904 a.pop(j) 

3905 continue 

3906 if a[j][0] == xstart: 

3907 hit = True 

3908 a[i] = reversed(a[j][1:]) + x 

3909 x = a[i] 

3910 xstart = a[i][0] 

3911 a.pop(j) 

3912 continue 

3913 if a[j][-1] == xend: 

3914 hit = True 

3915 x.extend(reversed(a[j][:-1])) 

3916 xend = x[-1] 

3917 a.pop(j) 

3918 continue 

3919 if a[j][-1] == xstart: 

3920 hit = True 

3921 a[i] = a[j][:-1] + x 

3922 x = a[i] 

3923 xstart = x[0] 

3924 a.pop(j) 

3925 continue 

3926 i += 1 

3927 return a 

3928 

3929 arguments = ex.args 

3930 dt = {} 

3931 for c in ex.args: 

3932 if not isinstance(c, TensExpr): 

3933 continue 

3934 if c in dt: 

3935 continue 

3936 index_types = c.index_types 

3937 a = [] 

3938 for i in range(len(index_types)): 

3939 if index_types[i] is index_type: 

3940 a.append(i) 

3941 if len(a) > 2: 

3942 raise ValueError('at most two indices of type %s allowed' % index_type) 

3943 if len(a) == 2: 

3944 dt[c] = a 

3945 #dum = ex.dum 

3946 lines = [] 

3947 traces = [] 

3948 traces1 = [] 

3949 #indices_to_args_pos = ex._get_indices_to_args_pos() 

3950 # TODO: add a dum_to_components_map ? 

3951 for p0, p1, c0, c1 in ex.dum_in_args: 

3952 if arguments[c0] not in dt: 

3953 continue 

3954 if c0 == c1: 

3955 traces.append([c0]) 

3956 continue 

3957 ta0 = dt[arguments[c0]] 

3958 ta1 = dt[arguments[c1]] 

3959 if p0 not in ta0: 

3960 continue 

3961 if ta0.index(p0) == ta1.index(p1): 

3962 # case gamma(i,s0,-s1) in c0, gamma(j,-s0,s2) in c1; 

3963 # to deal with this case one could add to the position 

3964 # a flag for transposition; 

3965 # one could write [(c0, False), (c1, True)] 

3966 raise NotImplementedError 

3967 # if p0 == ta0[1] then G in pos c0 is mult on the right by G in c1 

3968 # if p0 == ta0[0] then G in pos c1 is mult on the right by G in c0 

3969 ta0 = dt[arguments[c0]] 

3970 b0, b1 = (c0, c1) if p0 == ta0[1] else (c1, c0) 

3971 lines1 = lines[:] 

3972 for line in lines: 

3973 if line[-1] == b0: 

3974 if line[0] == b1: 

3975 n = line.index(min(line)) 

3976 traces1.append(line) 

3977 traces.append(line[n:] + line[:n]) 

3978 else: 

3979 line.append(b1) 

3980 break 

3981 elif line[0] == b1: 

3982 line.insert(0, b0) 

3983 break 

3984 else: 

3985 lines1.append([b0, b1]) 

3986 

3987 lines = [x for x in lines1 if x not in traces1] 

3988 lines = _join_lines(lines) 

3989 rest = [] 

3990 for line in lines: 

3991 for y in line: 

3992 rest.append(y) 

3993 for line in traces: 

3994 for y in line: 

3995 rest.append(y) 

3996 rest = [x for x in range(len(arguments)) if x not in rest] 

3997 

3998 return lines, traces, rest

4034def perm2tensor(t, g, is_canon_bp=False): 

4035 """ 

4036 Returns the tensor corresponding to the permutation ``g`` 

4037 

4038 For further details, see the method in ``TIDS`` with the same name. 

4039 """ 

4040 if not isinstance(t, TensExpr): 

4041 return t 

4042 elif isinstance(t, (Tensor, TensMul)): 

4043 nim = get_index_structure(t).perm2tensor(g, is_canon_bp=is_canon_bp) 

4044 res = t._set_new_index_structure(nim, is_canon_bp=is_canon_bp) 

4045 if g[-1] != len(g) - 1: 

4046 return -res 

4047 

4048 return res 

4049 raise NotImplementedError()

4051 

4052def substitute_indices(t, *index_tuples): 

4053 """ 

4054 Return a tensor with free indices substituted according to ``index_tuples`` 

4055 

4056 ``index_types`` list of tuples ``(old_index, new_index)`` 

4057 

4058 Note: this method will neither raise or lower the indices, it will just replace their symbol. 

4059 

4060 Examples 

4061 ======== 

4062 

4063 >>> from sympy.tensor.tensor import TensorIndexType, tensor_indices, tensorhead 

4064 >>> Lorentz = TensorIndexType('Lorentz', dummy_fmt='L') 

4065 >>> i, j, k, l = tensor_indices('i,j,k,l', Lorentz) 

4066 >>> A, B = tensorhead('A,B', [Lorentz]*2, [[1]*2]) 

4067 >>> t = A(i, k)*B(-k, -j); t 

4068 A(i, L_0)*B(-L_0, -j) 

4069 >>> t.substitute_indices((i,j), (j, k)) 

4070 A(j, L_0)*B(-L_0, -k) 

4071 """ 

4072 if not isinstance(t, TensExpr): 

4073 return t 

4074 free = t.free 

4075 free1 = [] 

4076 for j, ipos in free: 

4077 for i, v in index_tuples: 

4078 if i._name == j._name and i.tensor_index_type == j.tensor_index_type: 

4079 if i._is_up == j._is_up: 

4080 free1.append((v, ipos)) 

4081 else: 

4082 free1.append((-v, ipos)) 

4083 break 

4084 else: 

4085 free1.append((j, ipos)) 

4086 

4087 t = TensMul.from_data(t.coeff, t.components, free1, t.dum) 

4088 return t
